ajeffrey.teaching.util.guard

Interface Guard


  • public interface Guard
    A guard class. This provides an implementation of a mutable boolean variable, plus one extra method waitForTrue which blocks waiting for the guard to become true. This method may return true even when the flag is false, due to transitory values. For example, if the flag is false, and we have two threads:
    • T1 is blocked having called waitForTrue
    • T2 calls setValue (true) then setValue (false).
    T1 is guaranteed to be woken up, even though once it wakes up T2 may well have set the value back to be false again. This is called transitory values. If T1 wants to avoid transitories, it should do something like: 
       while (!(guard.getValue ())) { guard.waitForTrue (); }
    Version:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    Alan Jeffrey

      • waitForTrue

        void waitForTrue()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for the guard to become true. This method will block until the guard is set to be true.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
